result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald D Otterson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge on count one.  Bail to apply.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation.  Follow medication regiments as deemed appropriate by agent.

Defendant is prohibited from maintaining any social media accounts on any electronic devices.
No contact with the victim or the victims mother.

Obtain/comply with sex offender treatment.
Any electronic devices with internet capabilities to be turned over to agent for inspection upon demand.
Participate in cognitive thinking  therapy.
Report the make, model and license plate of vehicle to agent.
Obtain/comply with sex offender treatment.
Restitution set at zero.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession; voting.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald D Otterson Jr

records.addlTxt: Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 07/24/14. AR
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Ronald D Otterson in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 25.
Matter is set for jury trial on July 23 before Branch 25.  Parties have reached a resolution and plea will be heard before Branch 38.
As to count 1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility. 
As to count 2, pursuant to negotiations and upon motion of the state, the court ordered count dismissed and read in for purposes of sentencing.
Case is adjourned to 7-23-2014 at 8:30am Branch 25 for sentencing.
ADA Jennifer Williams has multiple trials set in Branch 38, Judge Wagner's court. Branch 38 offered to hear this matter for Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defense counsel contacted the Court to request a projected plea date. State notified. Case adjourned to 7/21/14 at 8:30 a.m. for plea hearing in Branch 25. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 7/23/14 at 9:00 a.m. Case adjourned to Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Notice of State's Intent to Introduce Video-Recorded Statement of a Child received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Ronald D Otterson in court with attorneys Amy C Scholz and Scott McClune.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Court needs to rule on the second part of defense counsel's motion to exclude unauthenticated evidence and hearsay statements. Arguments heard as to motion. Court denied defense motion for reasons stated on the record. Parties are still prepared to proceed to trial. State placed offer on the record. Court read maximum possible penalties to the defendant. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 7/23/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions
Defendant's List Of Witnesses
Defendant's Motion In Limine
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 04-30-2014 to repay Milwaukee County $50.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 05-01-2014. Cases include 14CF234.

Defendant Ronald D Otterson in court with attorneys Amy C Scholz and Scott McClune.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Defense requests an adjournment of the jury trial date due to scheduling conflicts of both attorneys. State does not object. Court grants defense motion for adjournment and vacates jury trial date of 06/25/2014. Arguments heard as to the second part of defense motion to exclude unauthenticated evidence regarding statement made by alleged victim to mother. Court denied defense motion as to the statement for reasons stated on the record. Court will revisit this matter if defense counsel makes an appropriate and timely objection at trial. Defense to file any additional motions by 05/09/2014. Parties to file witness lists, motions in limine, substantive jury instructions, and proposed verdict forms by the final pretrial date. Final pretrial and motion hearing remains scheduled for 06/06/2014 at 8:30 a.m. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Jury trial scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defense counsel filed a motion to adjourn jury trial date of 06/25/2014. Court ordered this matter be heard prior to jury trial date. Parties notified. Motion hearing scheduled for 06/06/2014 will remain on the calendar. Case adjourned for motion hearing on 04/25/2014 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 25.
Motion To Adjourn Jury Trial, filed by Attorney Scott McClune.
Defendant's Motion To Exclude Unauthenticated Evidence And Hearsay Statements, filed by Attorney Scott McClune.

Defendant Ronald D Otterson in court with attorney Amy Catherine Scholz.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Defense counsel intends to file motions to suppress out of court statements made by the defendant. Defense to file motions by 04/07/2014. State to file response by 04/21/2014. Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion In Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Ronald D Otterson in court with attorney Lucas Kaster.   Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Amy Scholz appeared and has been retained.  Notice of retainer received and filed.  Atty Kaster is relieved from representation and Atty Scholz is allowed to substitute in as counsel of record. Justice Point report receied and filed and reviewed by all parties. Defendant must verify hos residence with Justice Point prior to the next court date.   State is concerned that defendant has sent letters to victim's mother.  Defendant is warned that he must comply with the court's no contact order.  Defense request for a status to review the case, granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

14RM011136  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/26/14 vf

Defendant Ronald D Otterson in court with attorney Lucas J Kaster.  Defendant Ronald D Otterson in custody.  Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald D Otterson in court, in custody.  Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has not retained private counsel at this time.  Attorney Kaster is not able to appear for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Court informs the Defendant that the Preliminary Hearing will commence on the next scheduled court date and the matter of bail will be addressed at that time.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald D Otterson in court with attorney Lucas J Kaster.  Defendant Ronald D Otterson in custody.  Josh Mathy for Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Kaster has informed the Court that the defendant is requesting time to obtain private counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel in Branch PE.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald D Otterson in court with attorney Melissa Fitzsimmons, appearing as a friend of the court.  Defendant Ronald D Otterson in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for Jennifer Williams for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Fitzsimmons alerted the court of the circumstances regarding defendant's denial for Public Defender appointment.  She will continue to investigate the situation and discern if there may be an exception in this case.  
 Defendant asked that bail be modified.  State objects for reasons as stated.  Court will not modify bail at this time.  
.
 Court will appoint counsel pending continued investigation into defendant's qualification for public defender appointment. 
  Court appoints Atty Lucas Kaster as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60 per hour.  Attorney Kaster accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing on the conclusion of the case,  until paid in full. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Case remains set for preliminary hearing on 2-4-14 at 1:30.

Defendant Ronald D Otterson not in court, defendant in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for Jennifer Williams for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is in trial.  Case adjourned for status in Br 25.  Status conference scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald D Otterson in court, in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for Jennifer Williams for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is asking to get in contact with his mother for assistance with retaining counsel, however, his mother's phone number is contained on a phone which is being held in evidence.  ADA Lewis has no independent knowledge regarding this, as, it is not her case and she did not have the court file. The court was able to discern that the mother, Sherry Otterson, is currently residing in Wadsworth, Ill.  State should follow up, and defendant should make continued efforts to retain counsel for the next court date.   Case adjourned for status in Br 25.  Court ordered that defendant be evaluated by Justice Point, for appropriateness of GPS monitoring.  Status conference scheduled for January 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SLD dob 9/2/03 or Tanya D, their family, resi8dence, school or workplace

Defendant Ronald D Otterson in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Ronald D Otterson in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Indigency hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
